about (adv & prep) • about 500 students (adv) • The film is about a small boy. (prep)
act (n & v) • in the second act (of the play) (n) • to act in a play (v) • Stop acting like a child. (v)
boot (n) • a pair of boots • the boot of the car (Am Eng: trunk )
care (n & v) • take care of someone (n) • to care (about/for) someone / something (v)
course (n) • English course • main course • of course (exclaim)
dear (adj & exclam) • too dear to buy (adj) • Dear Sir (adj) • Oh dear! (exclam)
doubt (n & v) • I doubt that I'll get the job (v)
face (n) • a sad look on his face face to face (adv)
file (n) • Click here to open the file. • study files fill (v)
firm (n) • a good firm to work for first (adj & adv)
first (adj & adv) • first prize (adj) • first of all (adv)
fit (adj & v) • keep fit (adj) • These shoes don't fit. (v)
funny (adj) • a funny story (amusing) • a funny thing happened (strange)
grant (n) • He was given a grant to study in Australia. (n)
head (n) • to hit one's head (n) • the head of the company (n) • the head of the school (n)
hire (v & n) • to hire a boat (v) • for hire (n)
hit (n & v) • The song was a great hit. (n) • to hit the ball (v)
least (adj & adv) • the least amount (adj) • at least (adv)
lift (n & v) • Can you give me a lift, please? (n) • The lift is going up. (n) • Please help me to lift this table. (v)
manage (v) • to manage a business • to manage to do something (succeed in)
match (n & v) • a box of matches (n) • a tennis match (n) • This tie matches your shirt. (v)
matter (n & v) • Is anything the matter? (n) • It doesn't matter. (v)
mind (n & v) • His mind was on other things. (n) • Would you mind if I called tomorrow? (v) • Mind your head! (v) • Who's minding the baby for you? (v) • Make your mind up, quickly! (v)
model (n) • It's cheap because it's last year's model. (n) • She's a fashion model. (n)
note (n & v) • to write a note (n) • a ten-pound note (n) • Please note. (v)
notice (n & v) • to read a notice (n) • until further notice (n) • Did you notice anything wrong? (v)
off (adv & prep) • It fell off the table. (prep) • The meeting is off. (adv) • I've got the afternoon off. (adv)
online (adv & adj) • to book/buy something online (adv) • an online printer (adj)
order (conj, n & v) • in order to (conj) • to put something in order (n) • to order a meal (v)
over (adv & prep) • I'm going over the road. (prep) • over 40 people (more than) (adv) • to be over (finished) (adv) • Several birds were flying over the roof of the school. (prep)
own (adj, pron & v) • my own pen (adj) • on my own (pron) • to own a car (v)
park (n & v) • a public park (n) • to park a car (v)
past (adj, n & prep) • the past few weeks (adj) • in the past (n) • It's half past one. (prep)
patient (adj & n) • to be patient (adj) • a hospital patient (n)
pepper (n) • to pass the pepper (spice) • red peppers (vegetable)
place (n) • a safe place (n) • I've lost my place in the book. (n) • third place in a race (n) • London is a big place. (n)
plain (adj) • It's plain to me. (clear) • a plain T-shirt (no design)
plan (n & v) • a street plan (n) • a plan to do something (n)
play (n & v) • a play at the theatre (n) • children playing (v) • to play football (v) • to play the guitar (v) • to play a DVD (v) • to play the part of someone (act) (v)
please (exclam & v) • Come in, please. (exclam) • to please someone (v)
point (n & v) • to point at something (v) • The pencil has no point on it. (n)
poor (adj) • She is very poor. (financial) • the poor man (sympathy)
post (n & v) • to post a letter (v) • to send it by post (n)

present (adj & n & v) • to be present (adj) • at the present time (adj) • That will be all for the present. (n) • I got some lovely birthday presents. (n) • The winners were presented with prizes. (v) • She presents the late-night news. (v)
promise (n & v) • to promise to do something (v) • to keep a promise (n)
public (adj & n) • public opinion (adj) • to make something public (adj) • to be open to the public (n)
question (n) • to ask a question • the question being discussed (subject)
race (n & v) • to win a race (n) • to race against fast runners (compete) (v) • to race home quickly (run) (v)
rail (n) • to go by rail railway (n)
record (n & v) • to keep a record (n) • to break a record (n) • to record a song (v)
register (v) • He registered with a new doctor. (v)
reserve (n & v) • She was a reserve for the team. (n) • to reserve a seat (v)
rest (n & v) • a rest from work (n) • the rest of them (n) • The doctor told her to rest. (v)
return (n & v) • to return home (v) • a return (ticket) (n)

right (adj, adv & n) • the right time (correct) (adj) • the right person for the job (suitable) (adj) • my right foot (adj) • Everything will be all right. (adj) • Go right there. (directly) (adv) • Fill it right to the top. (completely) (adv) • the right to vote (n)
ring (n & v) • stand in a ring (n) • a wedding ring (n) • Give me a ring tomorrow. (phone) (n) • Suddenly the bell rang. (v)
rock (n) • rock (music) (n) • a hard piece of rock (n)
roll (n) • a roll of film (n) • a bread roll (n)
round (adj, adv & prep) • a round object (adj) • the wrong way round (adv) • to sit round a table (prep)
rule (n & v) • the rules of grammar (n) • to rule a country (v)
same (adj, pron & adv) • at the same time (adj) • Your watch is the same as mine. (pron) • You should treat everyone the same. (adv)
say (v) • to say something to someone • I really can't say. (give an opinion)
score (n & v) • The score was 3-0. (n) • to score a goal (v)
second (adv, det & n) • She came second and won silver. (adv) • This is the second time you've been late. (det) • sixty seconds in a minute (n)
see (v) • to see something (with the eyes) • to see the joke (understand) • to see someone about a problem (consult)
session (n) • in a school, gym set (n & v)
show (n & v) • a film show (n) • Show it to me. (v) • The picture shows a village. (v) • It shows that they care. (v)
sign (n & v) • a road sign (n) • to sign a document (v) • no sign of life (n) • signs of winter (n)
single (n & adj) • a single (ticket) to Manchester (n) • to be single (unmarried) (adj) • a single room (adj)
sink (n & v) • a kitchen sink (n) • The ship began to sink. (v)
slip (v) • to slip on the ice slow (adj)
smooth (adj) • a smooth surface (level) • a smooth ride in the new car (comfortable)
sound (n & v) • the sound of music (n) • It sounds like/as if… (v)
spare (adj & v) • spare cash, spare time (adj) • to spare the time (v)
square (adj & n) • a square room (adj) • a market square (n)
star (n) • stars in the sky (n) • a film star (n)
start (n & v) • a good start (n) • to start a race (v)
stay (n & v) • to stay to dinner (v) • to stay with friends (v) • to stay looking young (v) • a two-night stay (n)
stick (n & v) • a walking stick (n) • to stick two things together (v)
still (adj & adv) • I prefer still to sparkling water. (adj) • Sit still! (adv) • She's still here. (adv)
stop (n & v) • a bus stop (n) • The car stopped. (v) • It's stopped raining. (v) • The rain stopped me from going out. (v)
straight (adj & adv) • to go straight on (adv) • a straight road (adj)
strike (n & v) • to go on strike (n) • to strike something (v)
study (n & v) • to study physics (v) • to study the map (v) • Social Studies (n)
support (n & v) • She gave me a lot of support during my exams. (n) • to support a weight (v) • to support a team (v)
sure (adj & adv) • I'm sure you're right. (adj) • to make sure (adv)
sweet (adj & n) • sweet food (adj) • a sweet face (adj) • a sweet smell (adj) • to eat a sweet (n)
switch (n & v) • light switch (n) • to switch on a machine (v)
taste (n & v) • to have good taste (n) • to taste food (v) • It tastes good. (v)
tear (n & v) • Tears ran down her cheeks. (n) • to tear a piece of paper (v)
tie (n & v) • a shirt and tie (n) • to tie with string (v)
till (conj & prep) • to wait till the end (prep) • till he comes (conj)
time (n & v) • What time is it? (n) • It took a long time. (n) • the last time (n) • Is it time yet? (n) • Four times five is twenty. (v)
top (adj & n) • top of the class (adj) • at the top of his voice (n)
train (n & v) • to travel by train (n) • to train in a skill (v)
turn (n & v) • to turn your head (v) • to turn the page (v) • It's my turn. (n) • The wheels began to turn. (v)
type (n & v) • a type of person (n) • to type a letter (v)
underground (adj & n) • underground trains (adj) • to travel by underground (n)
up (adv & prep) • to walk up the hill (prep) • Are you up yet? (awake and dressed) (adv) • Lift your head up. (adv) • Speak up, please. (adv)
use (n & v) • Can you use a computer? (v) • It's for the use of teachers only. (n) • Is this any use to you? (n)
watch (n & v) • My watch keeps good time. (n) • I watched TV last night. (v)
wave (n & v) • waves at sea (n) • to wave goodbye (v)
wear out (phr v & adj) • You'll wear out those shoes. (v) • My shoes are worn out. (adj)
weekly (adj & adv) • a weekly magazine (adj) • to phone home twice weekly (adv)
welcome (n & v) • a warm welcome (n) • Welcome to London! (v)
well (adj, adv & exclam) • I'm very well, thanks. (adj) • to behave very well (adv) • Shake the bottle well. (adv) • Well, here we are. (exclam)
wish (n & v) • Best wishes. (n) • Wish me luck. (v) • I wish you were here. (v)
wood (n) • to be made of wood • in a large wood wooden (adj)
work (n & v) • school work (n) • to work for a living (v) • hard work (n) • to be out of work (n)
